summary: Professional portfolio website for Engr. Jerry Ebruvwiyor Osiobe showcasing engineering expertise, certifications, experience, and publications
architectural_notes: Single-page portfolio website with smooth scrolling navigation
Sections: Hero, Summary, Competencies, Education, Certifications, Experience, Publications, Interests
Contact information prominently displayed with email and phone links
Timeline-based layout for experience section showing career progression
DOI links for research publications leading to external sources
User will provide their own professional headshot photo to replace placeholder avatar
CV document attached as downloadable asset accessible from the portfolio

existing_features.title: Create a hero section displaying 'Engr. Jerry Ebruvwiyor Osiobe, MNSE, COREN' as the main heading, with subtitle 'Registered Engineer (COREN) | Member, Nigerian Society of Engineers (MNSE)', location 'Lagos, Nigeria', email 'osiobejerry7@gmail.com', and phone '+234-7025937757'

Create a Professional Summary section containing the text: 'Results-driven Engineer with expertise in Materials & Metallurgical Engineering, Project Management, Cybersecurity, and Data Analytics. Skilled in AutoCAD design, CCTV & Access Control Systems, Networking, and Fabrication Engineering. Adept at leading projects, analyzing data for business intelligence, and implementing secure IT systems. Recognized for strong problem-solving, technical innovation, and team collaboration.'

Create a Core Competencies section displaying these skills in a grid layout: Project & Systems Management, AutoCAD 2D/3D Design & Technical Drawings, Cybersecurity (Pen Testing, Log Analysis, GRC), Data Analytics (SQL, Power BI, Excel), CCTV & Access Control Systems, Computer Networking & Structured Cabling, Fabrication & Mechanical Installation, Risk Assessment & Quality Management, Strong Communication (English & Urhobo)

Create an Education section listing: B.Eng, Materials & Metallurgical Engineering from Federal University of Technology, Owerri (2019); OND, Ceramics & Glass Technology from Akanu Ibiam Federal Polytechnic, Unwana (2013); NECO & WAEC, Senior School Certificate Examination from Ibru College, Agbarha-Otor (2010)

Create a Professional Certifications section organized into five categories: Professional Engineering Memberships (COREN R75933, MNSE 66190, MNIMMME CM641, MIAENG 521253), Project & Risk Management certifications, Data & AI certifications, Cybersecurity certifications, Process Improvement certifications, and Technical Courses, displaying all certifications with their years as provided in the resume

Create a Professional Experience section displaying six roles in reverse chronological order: Fabrication Engineer at Nehemiah Grace Developers Ltd (Dec 2025 – Present), Cybersecurity Analyst Internship at NECA-ITF (Jun 2025 – Oct 2025), Data Analyst Internship at Techlytics Africa (Feb 2025 – Jun 2025), Project Engineer at Java Data Solution Ltd (Nov 2023 – Sep 2024), Project Engineer Contract at Pavilion Technology Ltd (Sep 2021 – Oct 2023), and Network Support Assistant at Michael & Cecilia Ibru University (Jan 2017 – Dec 2018), each with their respective bullet-pointed responsibilities as provided

Create a Research Papers/Publications section listing five papers with their titles and DOI links: 'Expert Systems in CCTV and Access Control Management' (DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.20538.86725), 'Introduction to CCTV Surveillance Systems and Applications' (DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.18049.31848), 'Business Continuity Plan using NIST SP 800-34 Rev. 1 Framework' (DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.32324.28804), 'Environmental Impact Assessment App using Prolog Reasoning' (DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.21890.95688), 'Unification of Real Differential, Real Difference and Modular Sequential Systems' (DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.23568.67847)
Create an Interests section displaying: Reading, Learning, Swimming, Travelling, Football
Implement responsive design that adapts seamlessly to mobile, tablet, and desktop screen sizes with appropriate typography scaling and layout adjustments

Apply a professional, modern visual design with a sophisticated color scheme (avoiding blue and purple unless as minimal accents), clean typography hierarchy, appropriate whitespace, and subtle visual elements that convey engineering professionalism and technical expertise
Replace the avatar placeholder in the HeroSection component with the user's uploaded professional headshot (IMG_0016.jpeg), ensuring proper sizing, aspect ratio preservation, and responsive display

Create a new CertificationsGallery component that displays the user's uploaded certification images (30 images including professional memberships, IBM certifications, Google certifications, HP LIFE courses, Six Sigma, project management certificates, and other professional credentials) in a responsive masonry or grid layout positioned at the bottom of the portfolio before the footer

Implement responsive grid layout for the certifications gallery that adapts to different screen sizes: single column on mobile, 2-3 columns on tablet, and 3-4 columns on desktop, with consistent spacing and alignment

Add interactive features to the certification gallery including hover effects on certificate images, click-to-expand functionality for viewing certificates in full size, and smooth transitions between states

Integrate the CertificationsGallery component into the main App.tsx component, positioning it after the Interests section and before the Footer, ensuring proper spacing and visual hierarchy within the overall portfolio layout

Configure the uploaded certification images (IMG_4327.jpeg through IMG_4190-1.jpeg, total of 30 images) as static assets in the frontend/public/assets/ directory and reference them correctly in the CertificationsGallery component

Add 30 newly uploaded certification images (IMG_4583-1.jpeg, IMG_4582.jpeg, IMG_4203-2.jpeg, IMG_4177-1.jpeg, IMG_4181-2.jpeg, IMG_4176.jpeg, IMG_4175-1.jpeg, IMG_4173.jpeg, IMG_4182.jpeg, IMG_4180-2.jpeg, IMG_4200.jpeg, IMG_4178-1.jpeg, IMG_4198-2.jpeg, IMG_4174-1.jpeg, IMG_4582-1.jpeg, IMG_4583-2.jpeg, IMG_4203-3.jpeg, IMG_4181-3.jpeg, IMG_4199.jpeg, IMG_4198-3.jpeg, IMG_4173-1.jpeg, IMG_4177-2.jpeg, IMG_4175-2.jpeg, IMG_4182-1.jpeg, IMG_4180-3.jpeg, IMG_4176-1.jpeg, IMG_4178-2.jpeg, IMG_4174-2.jpeg, IMG_4200-1.jpeg, IMG_4199-1.jpeg) to the existing CertificationsGallery component
Configure the 30 newly uploaded certification image files as static assets in the frontend/public/assets/ directory
Add a download CV button in the HeroSection component that triggers download of the CV PDF file when clicked
Ensure the CV download button is responsive and displays appropriately on mobile, tablet, and desktop screen sizes

Delete the CertificationsGallery.tsx component file from frontend/src/components/
Delete the CertificateModal.tsx component file from frontend/src/components/

Implement responsive grid layout in CertificationsGallery that adapts to different screen sizes: single column on mobile, 2-3 columns on tablet, and 3-4 columns on desktop with consistent spacing

Professional summary section highlighting engineering expertise
Core competencies section with technical skills grid
Education section with degrees and institutions
Professional certifications section organized by category
Professional experience timeline with roles and responsibilities
Research papers and publications section with DOI links

Professional styling with clean layout and typography

Add downloadable CV attachment to portfolio with download functionality
